type.const: New or closed events and markets

SubscriptionType.description:
Subscription Types and Detection Logic

Spike 🚀
- Definition: Sharp increase in probability
- Window: 1-3 hours
- Logic: current price ≥ 1.2x previous hour price (20%+ jump)

Drop 📉
- Definition: Sharp decrease in probability
- Window: 1-3 hours
- Logic: current price ≤ 0.8x previous hour price (20%+ drop)

Cross ⚡
- Definition: Market crosses a key threshold (e.g., 50%)
- Window: 1-6 hours
- Logic: price moves from below to above 50% (or vice versa)

Created 🆕
- Definition: New market added
- Window: Hourly
- Logic: New entry appears in market data

Closed 🔒
- Definition: Market resolved or betting stops
- Window: Hourly
- Logic: Market disappears or status changes to "closed"

Volatility Surge 🌊
- Definition: Unusual fluctuations in price
- Window: 3-6 hours
- Logic: std deviation of past 3 hours > 2x avg volatility

Breakout 🚀📈
- Definition: Price moves beyond support/resistance
- Window: 6-12 hours
- Logic: current price > max of last 6 hours (or min for breakdown)

Momentum Shift 🔄
- Definition: Trend reversal in price movement
- Window: 6-12 hours
- Logic: 3-hour EMA crosses 6-hour EMA (bullish/bearish signal)

Gap Up/Down 📊
- Definition: Price jumps up/down without gradual movement
- Window: 1-3 hours
- Logic: current price - last price > 10% with no intermediate prices

Whale Activity 🐋
- Definition: Large volume trades cause sudden moves
- Window: 1-3 hours
- Logic: volume spikes 3x normal (if volume data is available)

All-Time High/Low 🔥
- Definition: Market reaches new max/min
- Window: Daily-Historical
- Logic: current price is highest/lowest in historical data

Trend Reversal 🔄📊
- Definition: Long-term direction changes
- Window: 6-12 hours
- Logic: price consistently moves opposite to recent trend
enum: New or closed events and markets

type.const: New or closed events and markets

parameters.name: query
parameters.description:
The search query terms.

Will match query terms in event titles, market questions and tag labels.

Use `matchAny=true` to match any of the search terms (OR), or `matchAny=false` to match all of the search terms (AND).

parameters.name: matchAny
parameters.description: Whether to match any of the search terms (OR) instead of all (AND)
